snippet: With an eye for young talent and a head for numbers, Davey Johnson, baseball’s oldest manager, has held the Nationals to his spring prediction that they would compete for a pennant.
abstract: Washington Nationals manager Davey Johnson, the oldest in the majors at 69, has led the team to the best record in the National League since taking over in June 2011 after Jim Riggleman walked off the job.
lead_paragraph: With an eye for young talent and a head for numbers, Davey Johnson, baseball’s oldest manager, has held the Nationals to his spring prediction that they would compete for a pennant.

headline.seo: Davey Johnson Has the Nationals, Like the Mets of 1980s, In a Pennant Hunt
headline.main: Ideal Leader in Washington to Carry Youth Movement
headline.print_headline: Ideal Leader in Washington To Carry Youth Movement
